alert.note: Alert for Eastern Addison; Eastern Chittenden; Orange; Washington; Western Chittenden (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 4:48PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Orange, southwestern Caledonia, northeastern Addison, southeastern Chittenden and Washington Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 447 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Buels Gore, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Barre, Montpelier, Calais, Plainfield, Orange, Websterville, East Montpelier, Lincoln, Waitsfield, Berlin, Fayston, Middlesex, Barre Town, Northfield Village, Huntington, Washington, Warren, Duxbury, Northfield, and Moretown. This includes Interstate 89 between mile markers 37 and 62. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Addison; Eastern Chittenden; Orange; Washington; Western Chittenden
